For anti-money laundering supervision, y: For anti-money laundering supervision, you should contact the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants (CIMA) or the Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW).
The Equality Act 2010 helps to enforce,: The Equality Act 2010 enforces, protects, and promotes the rights of disabled people.
The Equality Act 2010 ensures disabled people cannot be discriminated against in employment, in education, or when dealing with the police.
Foundation schools are funded by the loc: Foundation schools are funded by local authorities.
Foundation schools have freedom to change the way they operate.
Foundation schools can sometimes be supported by religious groups.
Community schools are fully managed by local authorities.
Community schools are not influenced by religious groups.
Yes, after you pass your practical drivi: After you pass your practical driving test, the examiner will take your provisional photocard.
After you pass your practical driving test, the examiner will give you a driving test pass certificate.
The DVLA will usually send you your full licence automatically after you pass your practical driving test.
You can start driving as soon as you pass your practical driving test.
No, only one partner can claim the Marri: Only one partner can claim the Married Couple's Allowance.
The Married Couple's Allowance is claimed by the partner with the highest income for marriages and civil partnerships after 5 December 2005.
For marriages before the 5 December 2005, the Married Couple's Allowance is claimed by the husband.
Your pet must have a microchip, a rabies: Your pet must have a microchip.
Your pet must have a rabies vaccination.
Your pet must have a blood test confirming its rabies vaccination worked.
Your pet must have a GB pet health certificate.
If your pet does not have a GB pet health certificate but has an EU pet passport, you should call the Animal and Plant Health Agency (APHA) for advice.
Yes, you can apply to university as a ma: You can apply to university as a mature student.
You can apply to university even if you do not have traditional qualifications.
Some universities accept professional qualifications or relevant work experience.
You can apply to the Open University.
The Open University is open to everyone.
The honours committee makes recommendati: The honours committee's recommendations go to the Prime Minister.
After the Prime Minister, the honours committee's recommendations go to the King.
Having parental responsibility means you: Having parental responsibility means you have legal rights and responsibilities as a parent.
Parental responsibility includes providing a home for the child.
Parental responsibility includes protecting and maintaining the child.
Parental responsibility includes disciplining the child.
Parental responsibility includes choosing and providing education for the child.
Parental responsibility includes agreeing to the child's medical treatment.
Parental responsibility includes naming the child.
Parental responsibility includes looking after the child's property.
To apply for a UK passport while living: To apply for a UK passport while living abroad, you need to contact the nearest UK embassy or consulate.
The nearest UK embassy or consulate will provide you with the necessary forms and guidance to apply for a UK passport.
You will need to provide proof of your UK citizenship, such as birth certificate or naturalisation certificate.
You will need to provide your current address abroad.
The application process may take several weeks, so it is best to start early.
You can check the UK government's website for more detailed information on the requirements and procedures
To check if you're eligible for benefits: To check if you're eligible for benefits, you will need to provide accurate information about your savings.
You will need to provide accurate information about your income (including your partner's).
You will need to provide accurate information about existing benefits and pensions.
You will need to provide accurate information about outgoings such as rent or mortgage payments.
You will need to provide your Council Tax Bill.
You can use a benefits calculator to get an estimate of the benefits you could be entitled to.
You cannot use these benefits calculators if you're under 18.
You should contact a local benefits adviser for more detailed information.
